Subjective: Pain in the left ear for several days.
Patient feels as if there is water in the left ear.
The pain in the left ear increases after showering.
The pain score has increased from 4 to 6–7 after showering.
Patient wants to know what is wrong.
Patient wants to get rid of the earache.
Objective: Left ear canal shows signs of inflammation.
The left eardrum is poorly visible.
Assessment: Otitis externa on the left side.
Plan: The patient has been informed about the diagnosis of otitis externa.
The patient has been informed about the expected course of otitis externa.
Paracetamol 1000 mg up to a maximum of 4 times a day for pain has been recommended.
Ear drops with anti-inflammatory medication have been prescribed for the left ear.
The ear drops must be used 3 times a day.
The ear drops must be used for 1 week.
Advice given to keep the left ear dry.
Advice given not to clean the left ear with cotton buds.
